column1: outside off stump, a decent line but comfortably left alone
short and too wide. Bancroft just taps his bat through the line and gets himself off the mark
on the back foot, worked back down the pitch to the bowler
in the air but wide of backward point, just slapping his hands through the line. Loose but effective
down the leg side
tight line on off stump, and blocked
round the wicket, hits the seam but from a wide line, through to the keeper
outside off, nibbling away once again
tip and run, into the covers
crunched with a very straight bat, straight back down the line of the ball
outside off, through to the keeper
speared down the leg side
down the leg side
better line and length, on the back foot, punched to cover
on the pads, tucked to square leg
that's a better length, a fraction fuller and draws the edge, but it goes all along the ground to second slip
good leave to a tight line outside off, a fraction too short to force Bancroft to commit
ploughing a decent furrow outside off, playing the waiting game to the right hander
forward and tapped to short cover
angled into the front pad from round the wicket, good areas
leg-sided, clipped with the angle out to deep midwicket
what a shot. That is the most ominous shot of the morning. Pure timing, meeting a perfectly decent length ball on the front foot, and filleting it to the long-off boundary
on the toes, Warner looks urgent all of a sudden, another flipped run to the leg side
nothing wrong with that delivery, a touch of movement into the left-hander, but Warner met it right under the eyeline and tapped an instant single into the covers
over the wicket, angled across the bows. Solid block on the front foot
angled defence into the cordon
on the pads, worked square, England haven't looked like troubling either man so far ...
panned through long-off! That's sublime timing from Warner, another perfect punch to a length ball. A fraction wide but nothing shocking. That's just quality batting
defended on a tighter line, and another stolen single to a decent delivery
banged in short and wide. Aggression, and frustration, from Anderson
better from Broad, his best of the morning. Seamed away late and genuinely beat the edge
pushed onto the back foot and blocked back down the pitch
round the wicket, very full. Warner punch-drives and Broad fields in his followthrough
onto the front foot, worked into the leg side. Joining the dots...
straight-batted block, gathered at mid-on
well bowled, full length from round the wicket, defended on the line of the stumps to complete a handy maiden over
banged in short and Bancroft is caught on the hop there, didn't pick it up at all and fended off in a tangle
forward and blocked to the off side
on the pads, worked to the leg side
tight line, but strong and upright defence, into the leg side
short and sharp, Bancroft ducks
dangled outside off stump, no stroke offered
round the wicket, defended on the back foot
hammered into the deck from round the wicket, blocked once again
fuller and wider, floated out there but Warner doesn't take the bait
outside off, and through to the keeper
blocked again to the covers
dabbed into the off side and Broad makes good ground to intercept
wide on the crease, nibbling into the right hander, solid defence on the back foot
slightly hurried on the front foot, but gets enough bat on ball in the end
another cheeky short ball from Anderson that gets Bancroft in a tangle once again. Steep bounce from an awkward length, but he made a bit of a meal of that
more comfortably forward this time into the covers
short and sharp, more calmly negotiated this time
tapped into the off side, another maiden. England just about applying a tourniquet after a brisk Aussie start
defended on the back foot into the leg side
tapped to the off side, hanging deep in the crease to combat the full length
on the pads, that's a freebie flick to midwicket
worked to leg off the back foot
short and sharp, and again Bancroft is uncertain against the lifter. Wears this on the midriff as the ball gets up awkwardly
nudged to the leg side
a bit of movement away from the left-hander, but all too easily left on length
fired in short, Warner ducks
solid on the front foot
too short, too wide, Warner finally has a chance to free his arms, and that is battered through the covers. Who needs footwork when you've got an eye like a giant squid?
tapped down the pitch again
pushed out to cover
edged, but short of slip! Bancroft pushes outside off, with the ball coming in on the angle, but the ball dies short of Cook at first slip
full again, blocked down the track
wide line, keeps low
short again, and Bancroft is playing the short ball with the aplomb of Phil Tufnell versus Curtly Ambrose. Very curious, he's just not picking it up at all. And in comes a short leg at last
banged in short, but ducked this time
whittled to the leg side
short and wide, attempted cut, but can't connect properly
short and wide again, not the ideal line and length...
back of a length again, but tighter line, blocked to cover
wide and wild. Woakes hasn't quite found his range in this over
a pie from Woakes. Short, wide, panned into the covers by Warner, who can just loiter on the back foot and wait for the easy pickings
better line to finish the over
banged in short, no stroke offered
on the back foot, punched to the off side
up on the toes, pushed back down the line of the ball
short and sharp, but sails over Bancroft's shoulder this time
through to the keeper, wide line
tight line, defended into the leg side
short again, wide outside off, a slashing square cut through point and the sweeper again saves Woakes
a proper short ball this time, over off stump, Warner ducks
short of a length outside off, punched wide of the diving point...Woakes just isn't getting Warner forward
a half-hearted appeal for lbw as this nips back a touch, beats the inside edge, and takes him high on the pad
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
he's not finding it easy, tries to force this off the back foot, the bat twists in his hands, and the ball dribbles towards midwicket
round the wicket, full and straight, defended to the on side
a little shorter, on off stump, Warner plays back and defends to the covers
fuller, pushed towards mid-off who is about halfway back
uses his feet, takes this from outside off towards mid-on
opens the face and drives into the point area but can't beat the man
dragged down short and he latches on so quickly, rocks back and pulls powerfully through midwicket
good length outside off, 84mph/135kph, defended to the covers
a short ball which he ducks
back of a length at off stump, defended on his toes
worked into midwicket
gets a positive stride forward into a length delivery, pushes towards mid-off and there's a few extras for him as the shy at the stumps ricochets away. Crane the fielder
pushes a length ball with an open face through the covers, brings up the fifty stand
defended from the crease back to the bowler
a fraction fuller, played with a straight bat to the on side
more air, very full, driven through the covers, wide of the short cover, the sweeper gets more work
pulls the length back, defended
hint of drift in at off stump, Warner gets onto the front foot and pushes towards the mid-off who is allowing the single
gets away with a short one outside off which he bunts straight back to Moeen...been that sort of morning for Bancroft
pushed across outside off, left alone
a terrific piece of timing and placement from Warner, quickly onto the front foot to a full delivery outside off, almost gave himself a touch of room then opened the face to beat mid-off
short of a length, on the back foot and punches to deep cover
gets too straight, angled into the pads short of a length, clipped to long leg
and Warner finds one of them, the straighter one, as he drives on the front foot

this is the shot that's caused him a few problems, but this time the short-arm pull through midwicket comes off perfectly as he latches onto a short-of-a-length ball outside off...a very compact fifty for Warner who looks in the mood
starts full outside off, 81mph/130kph, driven back towards Curran who gets his left hand to it
bustles in, full, angled into the pads but Bancroft picks out midwicket with his flick
slashes over the slips! Short outside off, wasn't a great delivery, not out of the middle for Bancroft but he went hard and the top edge flew high over the vacant third slip area
gets back on a full length, 81mph/130kph, defended
width outside off but he doesn't time his square drive and finds point
good length, brings him forward outside off, slightly mistimed as he pushes to mid-on...a decent first over from Curran
good length outside off, sweetly timed on the front foot but finds mid-off
defends on the front foot
what a shot! That's a ripper, Warner onto the front foot and pings a pristine straight drive down the ground. Barely any follow through
pulls the length back, defended
stand a deliver drive this time, but finds short cover
opens the face and steers a full ball through the covers, no sweeper in place so it's a chase for point
good length at off stump, 84mph/135kph, defended to the covers
back of a length at middle and off, defended to the on side, he's settled nicely
drops this one in short, Warner rolls his wrists and helps it to deep square leg

that's his best short of the morning, on the back foot and punches sweetly through the covers as Curran drops short outside off. Does Anderson manage to flick it back? It's a fine effort, sliding with the flick back, and he gets the benefit of the doubt from the third umpire
short of a length, hops inside the line and nudges into the leg side
back of a length outside off, 81mph/130kph, defended
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
outside off, good length, defended to the off side
onto the front foot and plays a get-past-that defensive shot
a fraction shorter so he's not forward this time, defended to Root who is at short mid-off
shorter, wider, it's not a million miles from point as he doesn't quite get over the square drive but Curran can't reach it
back on a full length at off stump, defended
short of a length outside off, played from the back foot to cover
in the channel outside off, short of a length, defended on the back foot
walks into a defensive push and finds mid-off
shorter outside off, picks out point as he cuts
fuller, firmly punched into the covers
well bowled, gets it fuller, Bancroft is a little caught in the crease and there's a hint of uncertainty as he defends
skewed in the air through backward point, certainly not in control of this time, a full delivery outside off which he was hanging back to as he drove...off balance, but gets away with it
in control this time, into the front foot and pushes to the covers
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-off
outside off, short of a length, he's across the crease and defends towards point
a short ball, over his back
full at off stump, driven firmly back to Anderson who collects with his right hand then throws the ball back and hits the stumps
short of a length at off stump, defended
fuller at middle and off, pushed firmly to mid-on
that's a superb stroke, so at ease, a short ball at the body, he swivels on a pull, gets well over the ball, places it behind square
on off stump, fuller, defended
this one is on the pads and that's easily but away with a flick to fine leg
adjusts the line a touch, short of a length at middle, tucked into midwicket
back of a length at off stump, worked to midwicket
outside off, left alone
he's right across outside off and pushes a back-of-a-length ball to cover
that's a tight leave! Was that movement? Just appeared to shade back from short of a length and was pretty close to off stump
a short ball, angled towards the ribs, he gets out of the line but it looks awkward again
good length at off stump, defended to Jimmy who is already looking a bit miffed about things
round the wicket, full at middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full at middle, defended
brings out the big shot, doesn't matter that it's the last over of the session, stays in his crease and just lofts it clean over long-on. A century stand before lunch, dominated by Warner
quicker, flatter, pushed to the covers
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
driven firmly to mid-off
outside off, through to the keeper
on the back foot, tight defence back down the pitch
short again, Bancroft ducks
edged, and into the gap. That was streaky from Bancroft, wide of off stump, feeling for the ball, and taking a thick edge low through third man
better from Bancroft, tightening up on the back foot and blocked back down the pitch
short again, another duck, easily negotiated this time
short, leg-sided, that's just terrible. Warner hops into line and shovels a pull round the corner
better line, 'wait on!' is the call as Warner pushes to short cover
jags back in from round the wicket, defended
full, floaty length, another slapped drive but not timed this time
defended back down the pitch
decent nut, jagging into the left-hander
on the back foot
better length, and at a sharp pace
punched into the off side, on the front foot
banged in once again, through to the keeper with good carry
much wider on the crease, Bancroft works with the angle and flicks into the leg side
on the back foot, blocked down the pitch
defended on the back foot
on the toes, flicked to the leg side
defended back down the pitch
onto the front foot, punched to short cover
left alone with a yawning leave outside off
shovelled to mid-on, closing the face on impact
round the wicket and that's a good ball, really cuts back in off the seam and tucks Warner up as he hops across his crease
defended with a high elbow, back down the pitch
crashed into the off side, with a cavalier back-foot clobber, calypso in origin. He smoked it, but it was well intercepted
worked to the leg side
round the wicket, speared into the toes, but well dug out
wider line, Warner winds up for a slap through point, but thinks better of it
cracked hard off the back foot to cover
on the pads, flicked to the leg side
tight line, solid defence, on the back foot
full length and crunched down the ground. Warner capitalising the moment Broad strays a millimetre into his arc
full again but a touch wider. Warner leaves alone with a coiled-spring stance
on the pads, tucked all too easily off the toes. He's four away...
on the back foot, pushed into the covers
into the covers again, squared up a touch on the back foot

big appeal and up goes the finger! Bancroft knows a second opinion is futile. This was angled in, beat the inside edge, thumped the back pad, plumb in front of middle, to end a curiously durable innings from a man who never looked comfortable
angled in, defended right under the nose
speared into the toes, but well blocked with a soft-shoe shuffle
guided into the covers with a waft of the bat
round the wicket, wide of off stump, stays low as it kicks through to the keeper
dangled out wide. If Warner wants his hundred, he's going to have to come and get it
wide once more, and very full. It's a battle of wills out there...
just inside the tram-lines, as the boos ring out around the crowd. Wide and wider
straighter this time, Warner meets it with a firm drive but short cover snaffles the intercept
a perfectly pitched non-wide! Just inside the legal limits, and a gasp of affront from the crowd as they see that one on the big screen
well bowled, dangled outside off, angling back in towards the edge, and ghosting through to the keeper
attempted pull, keeps low as Khawaja finds thin air
a whistling drive, but gathered in the covers
full-faced defence, gathered at mid-on
outside off, and through to the keeper
compact in defence
wide again from Broad, and sure enough Warner has a snatch at this one. Under-edged into the crease
tighter line, solid defence to mid-off
drilled hard back at Broad, from a full length, and that's a good tumbling stop from Broad, who almost pulls off a deflection onto the non-striker's stumps
crashed, in the air! That was close to point, but out of reach as a cut squeezes down to the sweeper at backward point...
crashed hard to pojnt once again, but on the bounce this time
smashed hard once more, but Warner simply can't pierce the cover ring. England just sense a chance with Warner clearly itching to get through to his hundred
on the back foot, blocked into the off side
whittled into the leg side from round the wicket, Khawaja is off the mark at the 11th attempt
outside off, through to the keeper again
solidly onto the front foot
round the wicket, that's a probing line and length, right up to the bat
on the back foot, tucked into the leg side
well, there's the 6000, but not the 100! Punched into the covers, and the crowd gasps ...
on the back foot, a hint of movement off the seam. But only a hint
on the back foot. Defended
through to the keeper, grazing ever so close to the edge as Khawaja is pinned to the crease
whittled into the leg side, to bring Warner back onto strike
punch-drive into the covers, but not through them! He's hitting the field with some cracking shots at the moment
good shape from over the wicket, angled past the left-hander's edge
short, and hoisted to backward square, to get Warner back on strike once more ...
on the back foot, a cramped punch to point. The crowd oohs ...
round the wicket, a baseball-style bunt into the leg side. Just holding his bat in the line of the ball to deflect towards a gap

gone! Warner has utterly muffed the moment! A good length delivery, spooned off a top-edge to mid-on ... but it's a no-ball! Oh, this is just spectacular. Warner was halfway off, Curran was celebrating his maiden Test wicket, but the TV replay revealed his heel had crossed the line. It's a glorious Boxing Day farce!
flicked off the hip, and there it is! Off comes the helmet, out comes the trademark leap of joy, and there's some extra meaning in that moment. What an incredible couple of moments of Test cricket!
defended to the leg side. What scenes!
defended into point
full, wide outside off, strides forward and drives to deep cover
makes quite a late decision to leave this alone
good length outside off, through to the keeper
full outside off, left alone...a teasing line from Anderson
hangs it wider outside off, he doesn't play
that's a good 'un! Round the wicket, draws him forward with a good length, straightens a fraction off the seam to beat the edge
defends into the covers
back of a length, angled in at off stump, defended
a touch of extra bounce from back of a length, takes the splice as Warner defends down by his feet
fuller, he comes forward, pushes into the off-side ring
full outside off, 84mph, can't find the gap at cover as he drives...good over
defended from off stump
wider outside off, left alone
nicely bowled, hint of movement on a full length (is it a sign of reverse?), a slightly proddy defensive shot
a more compact drive finds mid-off
a shorter delivery, gets inside the line and tucks to midwicket
back of a length outside off, 84mph/135kph, defended to the covers...another maiden
short of a length outside off, played with a straight bat into the covers
nearly plays early at this one, coming forward into a full delivery, but pushes safely out to the cover sweeper
over the wicket, full outside off, driven back past the bowler but mid-on is stationed quite straight
gets turned around a little by a full delivery at middle and leg, looking to work through the on side and ends up sending it straight back past the non-striker's stumps
a slower ball, back of the hand, outside off, cut to deep point
full at off stump, defended
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
a short-arm jab from outside off finds mid-on
very full outside off, dug out to the covers
he holds this back a fraction, Warner has to stop himself pushing too hard
shorter this time, he hangs back and defends into the point area
full, wide outside off, left alone...Anderson ticks up another maiden
beaten outside off, pushing away from his body at a full delivery
angled in at off stump, Khawaja across the crease and defends
opens the face at a length delivery but can't find a gap in the off side
gets forward and defends into the covers...some excellent pressure being applied
full outside off, 82mph/132kph, left alone
driven to mid-off
stays round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
short of a length, pushed into the covers
defends a length ball to the off side

edged, and he's gone this time! It's a thin tickle and Bairstow grabs it low down. Round the wicket, that nagging line outside off and Warner has a fiddle. This time there will no abrupt turn as he walks off.
right across his crease, his back leg almost comes right around, defends to mid-on
fuller, at the stumps, hint of late shape in at Smith who defends on the walk to the on side
good length outside off, left alone
gets forward and drives a fuller delivery to mid-off
pushes into the covers
fuller, at off stump, pushed to mid-off
length angled in at off stump, no release for Khawaja as he plays to the covers
short of a length, no width to work with, defended to mid-off. Four consecutive maidens
full at middle and leg, defended to the on side
worked from a straight line, full length, into midwicket
then he's across the crease, a shorter delivery, defended with a straight bat
back of a length at leg stump from round the wicket, defended into midwicket
goes outside off, a short delivery, Smith plays at the top of the bounce into the covers
shuffles across the crease and flicks into square leg to get off the mark and break the run of maidens
over the wicket, full at off stump, pushed to mid-off
good placement from the captain, sign of a man in great form, plays forward to a full delivery, finds the gap with a little turn of the face
that's a poor ball, a rare one in the afternoon, dragged down short from round the wicket and Khawaja pull to long leg
back outside off stump, good length, defended
very full outside off, driven from the bottom of the bat and finds cover
takes this to the on side, bottom hand comes into play, mid-on is able to get across...not Woakes' best over
full outside off, no footwork as he throws his hands into a drive towards mid-off
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
gets a bigger stride forward, the ball was wider outside off, defended to cover
flicked from around off stump into midwicket
fuller, he comes forward and again picks out the infield as he drives to cover
that's a wild stroke! The pressure caused that. Broad bowled this wider, Khawaja went after it without any footwork, playing miles away from his body, beaten on the inside edge
full outside off, driven to backward point
defends into the off side
full and straight, clipped to square leg
takes a full delivery from off stump and plays a sweet bottom-handed whip to midwicket
back outside off, driven to the covers
shorter, at off stump, defended to the on side
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, defended
beaten! This is not a drill. That goes past the outside edge. Bairstow asks about the nick. Broad says he didn't hear anything. Bat may have clipped pad
full outside off, left alone
across outside off, defended into backward point, hint of late movement away
full outside off, left alone
tucked off the hip
too short, and that's not going to trouble Smith. A languid pull, fizzes through midwicket
better line and length, full and straight
up on the toes, dabbed to the off side
ooh, well bowled... hanging it outside off stump, and that one skids through as Smith hangs his bat out in an attempt to glide a single to third man
fully across the stumps and worked to leg with a touretic outburst to turn down the single
loose and loopy, on the pads and flicked into the leg side
angled into the pads from round the wicket, dabbed back to the bowler
over-pitched, and that's a fine strike from Khawaja, right under his nose, and punched with a full face through the covers
crashed into the covers once again but straight to the man this time
deflected into the leg side
striding forward, head over the ball, and blocked
flogged on the up, into the covers
defended on the back foot, outside off stump. A slower ball
another cutter, well watched with a straight bat outside off stump
wicket-to-wicket line, defended with body right back on the stumps
angled defence down through the gully
flashed on the up, off the back foot, capitalising on a hint of width, just putting bat through the line of ball and letting the pace do the rest

dangled outside off stump, and Broad has a wicket at last! The line and length was what lured Khawaja, just a hint of movement exacerbating the temptation, and Bairstow gathers the edge. Broad's first wicket for some 70 overs, I believe, and the end of a grim innings from the off-colour Uzzie

huge appeal! Cramped for room on the back foot, and Broad is utterly convinced! The umpire says no, but England review as well they might .... this looked very tight indeed! It was clipping the top of the bails!
Broad is up for another appeal! Very full once again, and angling down the leg side, but there must have been a temptation to take a look ... it was missing leg
drawn forward in a determined block to the off side
outside off, a bit of shape bringing that ball back into the left-hander as he leaves well alone in the end
worked off the toes to the leg side
straight-batted defence, gathered at mid-on
that's some sweet timing! Not a lot wrong with the ball, a fraction too straight if anything. But Smith shuffles across the crease and deposits a whip through midwicket
left alone outside off
tapped back down the track
a crashing drive, half-stopped by the diving cover, but Smith is suddenly looking in the mood. Emboldened by the faint air of crisis at the other end?
solidly onto the front foot
outside off, left alone
driven hard into the covers
driven off an inside-edge, a bit of wobble from a full length
solid on the front foot
wafty drive into the covers, a sharp single as the shy comes in
an inside-edged drive, into the front pad
flogged through the covers! No standing on ceremony from Smith, just a big stride and a flowing bat. A bit of a half-cocked attempt to haul the ball back in on the boundary's edge
squared up on the back foot, through to the keeper
down the track, driven with intent but no placement
wafted into the leg side
a shimmy down the track and a solid block
punched on the up into the covers
on the back foot, and worked to the leg side
outside off, tapped out to point
driven from a full length to cover
defended off a bit of an inside-edge, drawn forward
banged in short and tucked off the hip to the leg side
on the back foot, and turned round the corner
zipped through, outside off stump
wide of off stump, chopped firmly to deep point
flicked on the up, into the leg side
punched to mid-on, well timed, but too well timed to steal a single
back-cut, that's excellent timing and placement, just enough width to put bat though ball
solid in defence
drawn forward and driven to cover
up on the toes, punched to cover
squared up on off stump, and blocked
angled bat, blocked to the off side
slower ball, a very T20 variation, and Smith has to wait and wait before the ball finally arrives
inside-edge defence, down into the crease. Lots of variation and invention in that over
nudged round the corner
a flashy drive, on the front foot
waltzed down the track, meeting the half-volley and superbly threaded through midwicket. Shot
up on the toes, poked to cover
flicked along the ground, down to long-on
drawn forward, feet moving well in defence
outside off, crunched hard into the covers, well intercepted with a dive
solid block on off stump, as this one tails back into the right-hander
walks across the stumps, a comfortable tickle to backward square
round the wicket, solid block back up the pitch
solid in defence, as Curran attacks the off stump from round the wicket
attempted drive, but not timed. Good inventive bowling, keeping Marsh on his toes
a loose long-hop on the leg stump. Tucked with undue deference into the leg side
decent delivery to the the leftie. Blocked
a low full toss, driven to mid-off and badly fumbled by Vince. Village all round
on the pads, clipped on the up to bring up the 200. It's taken longer to get there than Warner's morning session had suggested
flicked into the leg side
round the wicket, fended into the off side
a stifled appeal, good intent from Curran as this one drifts too leg-sided
a back-of-the-hand slower ball, keeping it funky
this one tails in appreciably, but Smith just walks across his stumps to work with the angle. He's pretty good, you know...
round the wicket, left alone with a jerky shouldering of arms
full length, punched into the covers
striding forward and blocked down the track
stretching forward, pushed to cover
decent delivery, pitching middle and straightening into a solid block
on the toes, chipped on the up to midwicket
back of a length, punched back to the bowler
tidy over, seen off with a dab into the off side
that's tremendous, cracked on the up through point, rising to meet the short ball and guided to the rope
short again, Smith shuffles inside the line and pulls round the corner
round the wicket, Marsh leaves well alone
slower ball, but off-line this time. Still. he's mixing it up well
blocked into the off side, on the back foot
very full, dug out on the crease-line, and pushed back to the bowler
looped onto a good length
teasing flight, drawing a languid drive
on the back foot, worked to square leg
tight line, defended on the back foot
another firm drive to mid-off. Good areas from Malan
right on the money once more. This is good filler from the part-time leggie
length outside off, defended to cover
touch fuller, hint of shape away, driven to point
wider outside off, left alone
tighter to off stump, Smith shuffles across then shoulders arms
full and straight, Smith gets in his own position as he defends to mid-on
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off which means he keeps the strike and denies Anderson a comeback maiden. Fifty stand
misses a flick off the pads
full outside off, Smith gets well forward and defends
more air on this one, driven through the covers and Moeen is sweeping on the cover boundary instead of bowling
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
a flatter delivery, skids on a touch as Smith plays back
flicked away from off stump to square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
plays across the line of this, a delivery that is a touch fuller, closes the faces into midwicket
full at off stump, defended to mid-off
a little wider outside off, he comes forward and drives to cover
some late movement on a full length, a straight delivery, defended to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
full at straight, whipped to midwicket
gets well forward and defends
a little shorter, Smith can't beat the man at square leg
a yorker, not sure whether he meant it, dug out to mid-on
a low full toss but it doesn't cost him as Smith finds midwicket to stay on 49
a little shorter, on the pads, worked to square and Malan gets through a maiden
round the wicket, very full, driven to short cover
that's a beauty! Nips away late on a full length and beats Marsh's outside edge
pushes square into the off side
back of a length outside off, defended with an open face towards point
fuller, outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, a little shape back in at Smith who defends to mid-on so has to wait a little longer for that fifty
worked from outside off to deep square leg
defends to the on side, popped a little off the inside edge
uses his feet and whips to midwicket
gets to the pitch and whips it down to long on
tapped away
driven through the covers and that's the latest half-century for Smith. We've seen that somewhere before
round the wicket, defended to point
not far away! Short outside off, Marsh drags it to the on side and isn't far from sending a catch to midwicket
short of a length outside off, pushed square into the covers
goes for the pull, ball scoots under the bottom edge and gets taken high on the back leg
gets forward to a full ball and drives to point
angled in from round the wicket, defended under his eyes
tucked into midwicket
full at off stump, gets carefully forward and defends
dragged down short, you'll get a few of them with a part-time leggie, Marsh bisects the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
back on a good length at off stump, Bairstow asks the question whether it was pad first. He's the only one
whipped into midwicket, Anderson parries the ball with a dive
full and straight, worked down the ground to long on
length at off stump, defended
pushed towards mid-on
angled in at off stump, played up to mid-on again
fuller, at the stumps, dug out off the toe end
gets across the crease and tucks this off the pads to long leg
round the wicket, full outside off, defended
short of a length, angled into leg stump, worked out to deep square
round the wicket, short of a length outside off, pushed to the covers
opens the face and angles into backward point who can't stop it cleanly with a dive
full outside off, defended
full, a touch wider, defended to the covers
full outside off, hanging it wide, left alone
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended to mid-on
length ball outside off, into the covers
well bowled, shapes back from a good length and nearly cramps Marsh for room as he plays to point
full at off stump, clipped firmly to mid-on
that's a top shot! Threads the gap through the covers, a good stride out to meet the ball and a lovely high elbow as he drives
short outside off, picks out Moeen at backward point
gets across his crease and works a straight ball to deep square leg
drop and run into the off side, keeps the strike rotating
another back-of-the-hand slower ball, generates a touch of extra bounce and Smith adjusts late
defends a length ball to the off side
another slower ball, pushed down the leg side, Smith catches up with and nudges to deep square
full, wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, this one scuttles through to Bairstow...still the old ball
defended into midwicket
gets over the top of a short ball and pulls to long leg
round the wicket, full at off stump, might have been a cutter
speared in at off stump, keeping it full to try and extract some movement, defended to mid-off
driven firmly back to the bowler
defended to mid-on
79mph, straight bat into midwicket
full and wide, Smith reaches for it, away from his body, but the ball largely runs along the ground through gully to third man
pushed into the off side
takes a thickish inside edge and runs behind square on the leg side
full outside off, solidly blocked
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, a bit too close for the cut that Marsh plays and he finds gully
pushed down the leg side, an awkward one for Bairstow as it pitches just short of him. Good stop
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
defends a full ball to short cover...Broad hiding the ball as he runs in
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended to cover
short, wide and a wild shot from Marsh, a half-hearted swish outside off stump
what a beauty! That's the new ball. Full, just outside off, zips away from the outside edge and completely squares up Smith
full at off stump, makes himself get forward, defended
a little too straight, worked off the pads to deep square
back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
full and straight, hint of late swing, sweetly clipped to midwicket
that's another cracker! Rips across Marsh from back of a length at off stump. Unplayable
full, some late movement but Smith is able to push towards mid-on
full outside off, left alone
goes straight, at middle and off, worked into midwicket
full outside off, defended on the front foot to cover
angled in at off stump, back of a length, defended back to Broad
strides into the ball and defends to mid-off
short of a length outside off, pushed into the covers
full outside off, left alone
on off stump, behind the line into the covers
full at middle and off, defended to mid-on
safely pushed back to the bowler
full at off stump, back and across, defended to mid-on
round the wicket, full and straight, defended to mid-on
an appeal for lbw, this was a length delivery which beat Marsh's inside edge...looked a little high
gets inside the line of this one, uses the angle into him and tucks off the pads into square leg
over the wicket, full and a bit floaty outside off, driven firmly to point
full outside off, but not as full as the previous ball, left alone
wider, he's not interested in playing so early in the day. Quiet start
over the wicket, full at off stump, 80mph/128kph, defended to cover
on off stump, just back of a length, Marsh adjusts to a hint of movement and defends to point
defends a length ball into midwicket, his back leg came right around

onto the front foot, bat face closes a fraction and he plays to mid-on

works a straight delivery off the stumps into square leg
full at off stump, defended to mid-on
very full outside off, Smith drives and finds cover

short again, around leg stump, Smith has all the time in the world to get over the top and pull to long leg
over the wicket, a rare angle for Broad to the left hander, full at off stump and pushed into the leg side
short of a length outside off, 83mph/133kph, defended to cover
fuller, he's onto the front foot, plays to cover
a bouncer outside off, slippery from Anderson, Smith sways his head out of the line
drives into the covers
touch short, outside off, defended on the back foot to the off side
this one is fuller, brings him towards, driven to mid-off. Ten maidens for Anderson
on off stump, defended
pushes a length ball through the covers, a few cries from England as it was in the air for a little while but safely in the gap
back of a length, opens the face and pushes towards point
walks into a defensive shot
a shorter delivery, defended towards backward point
left alone outside off
outside off, left alone, reaches Bairstow at his bootlaces
fuller, he goes for the drive, the bat twists and the ball ends up at mid-on
lovely shot, full at middle and off, Smith whips it sweetly through midwicket for the first boundary of the day
back outside off, good length, defended to short mid-off
dropped in short and that's easily put away, pulled behind square and it beats long leg...takes him over 500 runs for the series
full outside off, middles his drive but straight to cover
over the wicket, 81mph/130kph, full at off stump, flicked to midwicket
defends a good length ball back to Broad who then throws at the stumps, hits, the ball deflects away and they steal a single. Pointless from Broad
full, wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, slides off the face towards backward point
full outside off, Smith ends right across the crease, see all three stumps behind him
good length outside off, defended back to the bowler
short of a length on leg stump, clipped towards midwicket for a sharp single...brings up the century stand

got him! Dragged on. This time it is his first Test wicket. His foot is okay, they aren't checking for the no-ball. Short outside off, Smith went to force it through the off side and gets a bottom edge into his stumps. For all the planning, short outside off works a treat!
good delivery, back of a length some some shape back in at Marsh who defends from the crease
top shot, lovely way to get off the mark, length ball outside off and it's neatly steered through backward point
almost finds the gap again, zings off the middle of the bat, touch of width outside off and he square drives towards point
back of a length at off stump, 80mph/128kph, defended to cover
line is outside off, defended to cover
full at off stump, pushed to the off side
prodded into the covers on the front foot
comes forward and drives to the cover sweeper who can't stop the second
a little shorter, defended on the back foot
played off the back foot into the off side
on the pads, neatly worked through square leg
on leg stump again, pushed firmly to midwicket
fuller, at middle, defended
a little too full and straight, clipped off the toes through the leg side
he's just lost his line this over, short of a length on the pads, clipped off his legs down to fine leg
fuller, at the stumps, defended to mid-off
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
floated up fuller, driven through the covers and more work for the sweeper
pushed back to the bowler
a shorter delivery, he's back and across to defend
a touch wider, brings Marsh forward and he pushes to cover
straighter, worked into the leg side. Not much on offer for Moeen
round the wicket, short outside off, steered towards gully
angled into off stump, tucked into square leg
outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, 82mph/132kph, defended

another drag on! England have worked out their tactics. Short outside off, Marsh aiming to play square through the off side, gets a bottom edge into the pitch which then bounces into the timber. Slow-pitch dismissals
good length outside off, left alone
round the wicket, good length, defended to cover...Moeen has a chance to the left hander
fuller, pushed to the off side
uses his feet, almost comes too far, digs out the ball to mid-on
good length at off stump, defended
down the pitch again, drives firmly into the pitch and it bounces towards short cover where Cook makes a diving stop
that's a very neat shot, touch of with from Moeen, Marsh threads it through the off side wide of point. Lovely timing
short outside off, doesn't work this time as Paine leaves it alone
full and straight, worked behind square on the leg side and they scamper a tight second
back of a length at off stump, defended to the on side
full outside off, just a hint of shape away, left alone
full at off stump, defended to mid-off
touch fuller, at the stumps, played to mid-on
flicked into the leg side, snaffled at short midwicket
solidly onto the front foot, looking for the single
tossed up and tapped into the covers to bring up Marsh's fifty - his third of the series, and another vital knock
on the pads, turning to leg, worked round the corner
firmly onto the front foot to defend
crunched into the covers
round the wicket, sits up to be spanked, and flashed with a wiggle of the wrists through third man
left alone outside off
worked into the leg side
back over the wicket, firmly forward to defend back down the line
over-pitched and punched sweetly along the deck, clean through the covers. Root gets a hand to take some of the pace off the ball, but can't prevent the boundary
good leave on a tight line, kept a touch low as it flashed past the off stump
solidly forward
good footwork to make room for the cut, chopped square for the single
poked into the covers, leaning onto the front foot
advancing down the track, gathered in the followthrough
hurried on the back foot, stands tall to defend
a quicker ball, fizzed into a stout front-foot block
ploughing a furrow outside off stump

tighter and fuller, left alone
a back-of-the-hand slower ball - he's used that well so far in this Test
forward and tapped to cover
slower ball attempted yorker. Emerges as a bamboozling cloud of misdirectedness, sliding past leg stump on the full. Nice thinking though
cracked through the covers! Wide and over-pitched from Moeen, and utterly panned with a firm stride and a full swing
onto the front foot, pushed back to the bowler as Paine looks to advance
clipped to leg
tossed up outside off stump and tapped through point
looped onto a good length, Marsh looking to be aggressive
that's sumptuous, a sashay down the pitch and a firm authoritative clip back past the bowler, too straight for mid-on to intercept. Moeen is being milked like one of Luke Skywalker's sea cows
worked down the ground
round the wicket, angled into the pads and helped through the leg side with a calm clip
a crashing drive! Leaning into the ball, head following suit, high elbow, clobbered along the ground. Sweetness and light
back of a length on a tighter line, Paine is aggressive in defence, looking for the single
left alone outside off
tapped into the covers
on leg stump, attempted flick, can't get it away
on the legs again, cramping for room, over the wicket to the left-hander, which is an angle that Broad didn't use at all yesterday
solid line and length on leg stump, met with a full face
worked into the leg side once again, nothing to work with there
pushed to the off side

a big appeal from Broad and England have reviewed! Broad reckons it's plumb, but that's rarely a fair indication. Certainly very full, and if there's no inside edge this is tight... sure enough, it is pad first. Hang tight... and it is out! Hitting the top of off, and that's a credit to the revised line of attack, bringing the stumps into play. Shock horror, it's been England's morning...
that's a violent welcome back to the attack! Short and wide, a bit of a loosener, and pummelled through wide mid-on!
tighter and fuller. Defended
wider line, punched on the up to point
tucked up on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
forward and defended into the off side

wide outside off, tempting Cummins first up

very full, almost too full, but a hint of shape through the air nonetheless

back of a length, tight line, edged along the ground to the first of those two gullies
full and straight, that's a very probing over from an old warrior. He's been below his best on this tour, but he's fought hard in this innings
lined up outside off, and left well alone

another drag-on! Paine swivels into a pull, and pays the price as the ball stays a touch low, flicks off the toe and cannons into the base of his leg stump! Signs of the wicket's two-paced nature, maybe? But that is Anderson's 520th Test wicket, which puts him clear of the former world record-holder Courtney Walsh
outside off, left alone
outside off, lifting off the deck, no stroke offered
edged and through the slips! A hint of reverse as Bird stabs a tentative poke outside off, the ball fizzed wide of Bairstow's outstretched glove but died short of first slip!
full and threatening. England are feeling it this morning
outside off, left alone
that's a lovely strike, confident and full-faced, through the covers
well bowled, just ghosting past the edge outside off stump
on the toes, flicked out to deep midwicket
well bowled again, this is tight and probing, just attacking the top of off with a hint of reverse swing to take it away towards the cordon at the last split second

big appeal and up goes the finger! Bird is walking immediately, but Cummins has called for the review, and why not, seeing as they've got a spare. No bat involved though, so this is surely dead. Wicket to wicket, recalibrating the line from off to middle, and the tailender had no answer
good wicket-to-wicket approach, fenced into the covers with a high elbow
blocked back down the pitch
attacking the top of off, poked into the covers

tailing in late, but Cummins is equal to it, waiting for the ball to arrive before committing
forward and tapped through third man
full at off stump, defended to cover

edged, taken low down at slip! Nicely done by Broad, pushing full outside off, Cummins goes for the drive, the edge reaches Cook very low. And now the umpires are checking if it's carried. The soft signal is out. Cummins is almost off the ground. Safely into the hands. Well taken by Cook. That will be a quick confirmation by the third umpire.
full outside off, slides off a thickish outside edge towards gully
good length at off stump, defended
touch fuller, pushed up to mid-off
beats the edge, excellent delivery, good length outside off with some nibble away. Top stuff from Broad

short of a length at off stump, pushed into the covers

gets forward and drives back to the bowler
shovelled wide of mid-on so he'll keep the strike
over the wicket, full outside off, driven to cover
short of a length, pushed off the back foot

at off stump, good length, solidly played into the covers

full outside off, nicely driven towards mid-on but a good intercept by Cummins
another good-looking drive as he picks out mid-off this time

worked off the pads wide of mid-on
full at the stumps, defended on the front foot
full outside off, a strong drive through the covers, gets into a very nice position

another excellent drive, full outside off from round the wicket, onto the front foot and places it through the covers
over adjusts, pushes this down the leg side...and he's overstepped
shoved down the leg side again
a bouncer over off stump, Stoneman ducks

back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
fuller, 84mph/135kph, defended square to point
driven firmly back to the bowler
short of a length at off stump, defended to the on side
short ball, Cook goes after it with a pull, doesn't come off the middle and balloons past square leg
short outside off, he drops his hands and lets it through...dies on the way to Paine
full outside off, driven firmly into the pitch and it bounces up to point
short of a length at off stump, not a full-on bouncer, Stoneman rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square
stays round the wicket, full and straight, 84mph/135kph, punched to mid-on
good length angled in, defended to mid-off
a fraction shorter, pushed into the off side
a shorter delivery, this time Stoneman doesn't connect with his pull and gets taken on the pads
back of a length, this skids through a little, may have taken inside edge into the pad as Stoneman aimed to work it away
full and straight, a sweetly struck on-drive but Cummins makes a good save at mid-on
good length from round the wicket, Cook gets forward with a straight bat
fuller, pushed with an angled face into the off side
short of a length, he's behind the line and pushes into the gap at cover
good length outside off, onto the front foot and plays to the covers
a little short outside off, he cuts but it's well cut off by a diving Lyon at point. The crowd love that
this time he gets a pull off the middle of the bat, this is a super shot, scoots quickly to deep square leg
round the wicket, worked away off middle, wide of short leg, behind square
gets forward and tucks into the leg side
drifts into the pads, flicked wide enough of the man at midwicket to allow the single

a touch fuller, driven towards mid-off and that's a sharp single
onto the front foot, pushed to the off side
head right over the ball, meeting the full length from round the wicket
leaps wide on point of delivery to increase the angle into the left-hander. Blocked solidly
tapped into the off side, compact strokeplay to a probing line and length
wide of off stump, no chasing that one

pushed into the off side
big stride down the pitch
eased off the hip out to midwicket
big stride, straight down the pitch
nudged into the gap, good strike rotation
chopped backward of point, no great spin in evidence for Lyon so far
stupendous punch down the ground! Full face, perfect timing, and a very athletic bit of boundary-riding to save the four. But that was compact in the extreme
solidly onto the front foot
driven! Now then, that's not a shot that Cook brings out of the locker unless he's really feeling in the mood. Big stride, head over the ball, and pumped through the covers. Intriguing
blocked with purpose, back down the pitch
tight line, solid defence
stands tall in defence to push into the covers
round the wicket, looped onto a good length, tapped to cover

aggression from Stoneman and he's paid the price! Down the wicket, looking to hit against the spin, but he chips a fast leading edge high to Lyon's right, who sticks out a mitt and plucks a blinder! There's the justification for Lyon's early introduction, and England's solid day's work has its first wobble
stretching forward, full face of the bat
leaning into a front-foot poke
big stride, working round the front pad, that's the end of a very telling over
on the back foot, punched to the off side
forward and blocked
on the back foot, pushed into the crease. Defended again
poked to cover with high hands
angled into the off side
on the pads, tries to work it square but can't time the stroke
blocked

not a lot of spin in evidence as Cook punches to point
flogged through the covers! Beautiful from Vince, as they always are when he middles them. Big stride, knee bent, boundary caressed
solidly forward
big stride, a bent-knee block into the covers
round the wicket, met on the front foot, pushed to the leg side
clipped with lovely timing as Bird angles into Cook's toes, but a sharp pounce at short midwicket
crunched down the ground. Cook is cooking! A back-foot steer, presenting the full face with impeccable timing
outside off, tapped firmly to deep point
banged in short, keeps a touch low as VInce curls into a pull
on the back foot, defended
tapped back to the bowler
angled round the front pad, gathered at midwicket
back of a length from over the wicket. Defended solidly back to the bowler
smashed with massive intent! Down the track, pivoting round the front leg as Lyon turns the ball into a flamboyant flog over the leg side
clipped round the front pad i
striding forward and blocked again
another firm drive, but this time straight to the man at short cover

high-elbowed defence back down the pitch
turning into the pads, helped on its way through square leg

adjusting the feet as Vince sizes up the cut

a big appeal! But that looked to be sliding down leg. Yes ... ambitious
flicked off the hip, to midwicket
head over the ball in defence, a second over-step in the over.
well bowled! A wobbly off-stump length, nibbling off the inside edge and into the front pad

down the leg side and a huge appeal! Was there bat on that one, the Aussies aren't sufficiently convinced to have another look
striding forward and blocked into the covers
on the pads, flicked firmly to the leg side
good line and length
a touch too short, and clobbered to deep cover
stretching forward, dotted back down the pitch
solidly into line
fenced into the gully, keeping the ball down though
wicket to wicket line, pushed back down the pitch
wider on the crease, Vince works with the angle to flick round the corner
propping forward to defend
a touch of width, dabbed into the off side
outside off, left alone
a firm-handed push back down the pitch, two close catchers on the off side in attendance
shorter, and hoicked into the leg side

firmly into line, on off stump. Met with a full and cautious face, as there's a hint of swing in the offing

chopped a touch uppishly through the gully! Hands twisting on impact as he's drawn into a wide one. But gets away with it in the end
pushed to the off side
through to the keeper with no stroke offered
angled bat, down through third man, always in control of that one
round the wicket, short of a length, defended
dismissive! Short outside off, 83mph/133kph, Cook cracks a pull shot through midwicket. That was a beauty
this one is fuller, defended to the covers
good length outside off, left alone...Cummins not looking too flash
short outside off, he can't beat point as he cuts just in front of square
top shot! Short of a length outside off, Cook gets onto his toes and punches it at the top of the bounce through the covers. Full of class

full, straight, gone! That's stone dead. Gets in on the full length, at the stumps, perhaps just a shade of reverse - although more like seam movement - and Vince basically misses it. Oh dear, oh dear! The replay has shown he's got an inside edge! Vince had no idea he'd hit it, just asked Cook if it was sliding down
full at off stump, defended
back of a length at off stump, defended
nicely bowled, angled in from outside off, left alone
short of a length, defended to cover
touch wider, Root lets it go through...that looked a slightly round-arm delivery, hiding the ball as he runs in

worked from outside off to the left of mid-on

good length, 84mph/135kph, played to the on side
flicked from outside off into midwicket

fuller, on the pads, beats midwicket this time as he flicks it away
gets forward to a full one outside off, plays with a closed faced into the leg side
back of a length outside off, defended
he's off the mark with a nicely-placed drive off the front foot through the covers
driven into the covers
this one comes back nicely in the air, defended to the on side, Root needs to be careful not to play around the front pad
short of a length outside off, pushed towards point
fuller, at the stumps, defended to the covers
short and he gets this through midwicket with a pull
back of a length, defended
back of a length outside off, 83mph/133kph, defended to mid-off...this is a big effort from Cummins
fuller, he gets forward with bat and pad together
across onto off stump and defends to cover
full and straight, clipped through square leg, lovely piece of timing and that's Cook's first fifty of the series ..and his first fifty in Australia since the 2013 Boxing Day Test.
pushed into the off side
full and straight, turned into midwicket
full outside off, big stride forward and he drives to point
back and across, defended towards mid-on
he was in pretty good control of that, steers a full delivery between slip and gully with a turn of the wrists.
full and straight, driven to mid-off

over the wicket, back of a length, punched to mid-off
defended to one of the short covers
full at middle and off, 86mph/138kph, defended to the bowler
back of a length outside off, plays this late and angles it through backward point

gets a bouncer first ball and unlike Woakes he goes underneath
full outside off, left alone...not sure we'll see any changing of gear from Cook yet
punches to short mid-off
full outside off, a well-struck on-drive hammers into Bird's boot as he follows through
touch short and wide outside off, chopped to deep point
nicely bowled, full outside off and it skims past the outside edge as Curran pushes forward
back of a length at off stump, 79mph/127kph, solidly behind the line
over the wicket, short outside off, Cook pulls and it goes quickly out to deep square leg
a bouncer, he ducks
another short one, this balloons over Curran's head
thick outside edge down to third man for his first Test runs, pushing forward to a full delivery outside off...scorebook only says four, he can say it was a cover drive
worked off his pads wide of short leg, may have been a single on offer
finishes the over with another short one, at 84mph/135kph, and Curran ducks
goes for his favourite square cut, gets beaten over the top edge
this time it comes off the middle, a square drive out to deep point
full and straight, defended
back of a length outside off, nicely onto his toes and driven to mid-off
fuller at off stump, driven back to the bowler
a short ball angled down the leg side, he goes for the pull and it's not far from another glove or edge through to Paine
a short, slower ball, 75mph/120kph, Cook bails out of his thoughts of a pull and the ball loops second bounce to the keeper
this short delivery is straighter, and quicker, Cook pulls to one of two men either side of square leg
defended to the off side
comes forward and pushes to mid-off
round the wicket, another short one, and again Cook finds one of the men at square leg
gets inside the line and tucks this off his body to backward square leg...Cummins' first maiden
nice delivery, full outside off, beats the outside edge
defends this one off the middle to cover

short of a length, Broad jumps behind the line (just about) and defends towards gully
another appeal for a catch behind as Broad flicks at a short-of-a-length delivery down the leg side...they consider the review, but decline
vicious bouncer! Right at Broad's throat and he can't get out of the line. Jerks his head back and gets taken on the shoulder
full at off stump, defended
back of a length, punched to short cover
gets the pull away, out to deep midwicket
round the wicket, short, at the body, Broad fends it down by his feet
short, angled down the leg side as Broad jumps across to the off
and another short one, outside off, he sways out of the line...he hasn't had one in his half yet
pushes a length ball to the on side and takes the run on offer which exposes Broad
stands on leg stump and pulls this short ball pretty sweetly into midwicket
somehow gets this into the off side, flaps it into the off side with a horizontal bat as it's again pitched in the bowler's half
on the pads from round the wicket, clipped down to long leg
short, down the leg side, an easier one to get inside the line of
short on leg stump, flicked in the air just past short leg but that single will mean he faces the next over
gets it over slip! He was backing away to the leg side, then somehow glanced it over Smith off the splice of the bat
moves outside leg and heaves across the line of a short-of-a-length delivery, doesn't make contact
gets well behind the line of his, short at off stump, defended
over the wicket, short (probably don't need to say that), Broad is through his cross-batted swipe a little early and the ball flies through to the keeper
back round the wicket, short of a length on middle and leg, well played as he jumps behind the line and keeps it down in front of short leg
pushed down the leg side, a slower ball, bobbles to the keeper
works a straight delivery through square leg and again takes the single
gets a fat top edge as he pulls at another short delivery and it flies straight back over the keeper's end
there's a full one - the first he's had this innings - Broad crabs across the crease and it runs off a thick edge to gully
back to the short stuff, he jumps right across outside off and knocks into space on the off side
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
what a beauty! Drives on the up outside off, sends it whistling to the cover boundary. A free swing of the arms. Into the 190s
big appeal for lbw first ball, Broad goes for the sweep and misses. Takes a bottom edge into the pad. Smith doesn't review
floated up full at off stump, driven to short cover
full and straight, defended
brings out the paddle sweep, gets it down to long leg...Broad wants the second
pushed into the off side
stretches forward and plays into the covers, can't get the strike back
pulled from outside off to deep square leg so Cook is back on strike
full outside off, pushes to the one man saving the single at cover
left alone outside off
short on leg stump, pulled to long leg...two balls for Broad
goes for the yorker, pitches outside leg stump and swings back as it scoots past Broad's feet
gives himself room to the leg side and carves away a length delivery through backward point. Bonus runs for England
down the ground! He uses his feet and clubs this over mid-on...not something you see every day. Also takes England over 400
stays in the crease and blocks a full one
flicked from outside off towards mid-on who has gone a little deeper
a deft paddle sweep down to fine leg
pushes a length ball into the off side and that's a well-taken single
gets forward and plays a solid dead-bat block
dabbed into the covers, through they go
tapped into the off side, another single, he's battled supremely for the cause
perfectly straight bat, but gathered at mid-on

drilled down the ground in sublime fashion, and what a way to reach his double hundred! What an ovation from the G - 563 minutes of technical application and mental fortitude, and he's still going strong
short, and hauled down to backward square
hopping onto the  back foot, dabbed down to third man
round the wicket, dobbed onto a good length, punched to cover
forward and blocked
full face of the bat
stabbed into the covers
very wide of off stump, Broad lines up a cut but leaves alone in the end
leaning forward, smothered defence
floated onto the pads, and that's wafted with insouciance out through midwicket. Languid and effective, pulls up just inside the rope but a lovely strike
opens the face on a steer into the covers
punched into the off side
cracked through the covers! Making room outside leg, and flogged through the off. Boshing
back onto the stumps, worked to the leg side
banged in short, and spanked out through the leg side. Broad is actually enjoying his batting on this pitch
stretching forward, blocked down the track
tossed up, right onto the crease-line. Defended into the covers
punched back to the bowler
angled prod out to point
good scampering to get the lead past 100
bosh! Broad clears the front leg, swings clean through the line and deposits a mighty mow over long-on!
worked into the leg side
Broad retreats to leg to negotiate a full-length delivery, punched into the covers where Bancroft leaks the single
flipped through the leg side, gathered with a measured chase
back and across, fenced to the leg side
banged in short, Broad attempts a slash over the cordon but can't make contact
backs and thwacks! Leaning out towards the square leg umpire, but clobbered hard over the covers. The runs are pouring now!
tossed up from round the wicket, punched down the ground
leaning forward, pushed to the covers
stretching onto the front foot, and pushed back to the bowler
back of a length, dabbed through third man

zipped through to the keeper
round the wicket, punched on the up, into the covers

tapped into the covers

another stepladder slash over the slips, No contact
drawn forward to defend
on the pads, flicked to leg
punched into the off side

a swishy sweep, decent contact

nudged off the pads
back of a length, punched on the up, into the covers

tighter line, patted back to the bowler
a shade outside off, just back of a length, tapped to third man to keep the strike
a teasing back-cut, intercepted millimetres from the third man rope
dabbed to third man
a full-blooded sweep to deep backward square. He's two away from a hugely improbable fifty
on the pads, tucked square
poked into the leg side
chipped into the leg side
a crashing round-house pull, and he's utterly nailed it through square leg for a hugely gutsy fifty! He's worn the short stuff, and given it back in spades
panned over midwicket for the 100 partnership! Another bouncer, nailed so perfectly that Lyon, at deep midwicket, thought he was running in for a catch before realising it was sailing over his head!
down the leg side, good heat on that short ball
another bouncer from round the wicket. Broad has a flap but can't make contact

slashed high and hard into the deep ... Khawaja hurtles round to scoop a tremendous take, low to the ground. The umpires are conferring to make sure it carried... but the soft signal is out, so let's see ... nope, that has burst through his hands on impact, so Broad will bat on! Or will he? tapped out to point
pushed back down the pitch
head over the ball, punched into the covers

hopping down the leg side
solid block, and a huge cheer from the Barmy Army, as they get to have Bird in front of them on the boundary's edge again

driven into the covers

pushed down the pitch to complete England's finest day of the series.

back of a length, through to the keeper

short of a length, clipped off the hip through square leg...positive start from Australia
short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot and it goes in the air for a while but wide of cover

short of a length outside off, left alone
short outside off, cut into the ground and bounces to cover

width at last for Warner, and utterly crunched. That's where he likes it, wide and wallopable, through the covers
pushed firmly down the pitch
forward, head over the ball, dabbed to the leg side

stretching onto the front foot

outside off, through to the keeper

very full, tucked sweetly through the leg side. Woakes was trying to give the ball every chance to shape away, but he started on the wrong line
